name: curl
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C or U ] a piece of hair that grows or has been formed into a curving shape, or something that is the same shape as this: tight/loose curls Her hair fell in curls over her shoulders. Curls of smoke were rising from the chimney. Compare
wave noun (HAIR CURVES)
enginakyurt11/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
[ C or U ] UK (also curve) the curved shape in which a ball moves when it is hit or kicked in a particular way: The curl on the shot sent it looping around the keeper into the far corner of the net.
[ C or U ] an exercise using weights in which you move your arm or leg from straight to bent and back: She uses 5-pound weights for bicep curls. Twice a week, do both leg extensions and leg curls on a weight machine.

curl verb
(MAKE A SHAPE)
[ I or T ] to make something into the shape of a curl, or to grow or change into this shape: Does your hair curl naturally, or is it permed? A new baby will automatically curl its fingers round any object it touches.
[ I or T ] to make a ball move in a curved shape by hitting or kicking it in a particular way or of a ball, to move in this way: He curled the ball into the top right hand corner. Peterson's free-kick curled just wide. curl your lip
to show by an upward movement of one side of your mouth that you feel no respect for something or someone: Her lip curled at what he said.
